docs.lead_paragraph: An article on Sunday about a prenatal clinic in Brooklyn that treats immigrant women misspelled the surname of its social worker. She is Josette Crevecoeur, not Crefvecoeur.
docs.abstract: Correction of July 22 article on prenatal clinic in Brooklyn that treats immigrant women, which misspelled surname of social worker
docs.snippet: An article on Sunday about a prenatal clinic in Brooklyn that treats immigrant women misspelled the surname of its social worker. She is Josette Crevecoeur, not Crefvecoeur.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives moved one step closer today to tackling the thorny issue of cloning, when the Judiciary Committee, voting along party lines, approved a bill that would outlaw not only cloning people, but also the use of cloning technology to treat disease. The vote, 18 Republicans in favor and 11 Democrats against, was expected. When the measure reaches the House floor, opponents are expected to argue that it should be limited to a simple ban on cloning humans. A vote could take place as early as next week.

headline.main: House Judiciary Panel Passes a No-Clone Bill

docs.abstract: House Judiciary Committee, voting along party lines, approves bill to outlaw cloning of people and also use of cloning technology to treat disease (S)
